If there are no coincidences in Taylor Swiftâ€˜s world, then her ever-observant Swiftie fans are convinced that the pop superstar will headline the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show.

Well, during Swiftâ€™s appearance last week on the New Heights podcast, hosted by boyfriend Travis Kelce and his brother Jason, fans picked up on a few hints â€” including an extended conversation about baking sourdough bread. articles.title: Taylor Swift Streams Rise in Anticipation of Recently Announced â€˜The Life of a Showgirlâ€™
articles.content:
---
title: Taylor Swift Streams Rise in Anticipation of Recently Announced â€˜The Life of a Showgirlâ€™
author: Kyle Denis; Jason Lipshutz; Andrew Unterberger
url: https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/taylor-swift-life-of-a-showgirl-new-album-streams-1236048500/
hostname: billboard.com
description: This week's Trending Up looks at gains across Taylor Swift's catalog in the wake of her 'Life of a Showgirl' new album unveiling.
sitename: Billboard
date: 2025-08-20
categories: ['Chart Beat']
tags: ['genre pop, Trending Up']
---
Welcome to Billboard Proâ€™s Trending Up newsletter, where we take a closer look at the songs, artists, curiosities and trends that have caught the music industryâ€™s attention. Some have come out of nowhere, others have taken months to catch on, and all of them could become ubiquitous in the blink of a TikTok clip.
This week: Taylor Swiftâ€™s announcement of her upcoming 12th album leads to streaming gains across her catalog, Cardi B helps a Jay-Z fan favorite find new life, a 20-year-old metal cut goes viral for bizarre reasons and more.
The Streams of a Showgirl: Taylor Swiftâ€™s Catalog Booms Following Album Announcement
Not only did Taylor Swift announce her 12th studio album, The Life of a Showgirl, last week, but she did so in a way that became a multi-day news cycle â€” first teasing a new era and appearance on her boyfriend Travis Kelceâ€™s New Heights podcast on Monday (Aug. 10), then revealing later that day that the podcast interview would include plenty of information about her new album, and then unveiling all of the Showgirl details in a wide-ranging discussion on Wednesday (Aug. 12), with those meme-able moments and potential Easter eggs powering Swifties through the end of last week. Although fans will have to wait until Oct. 3 for Swiftâ€™s new album, they didnâ€™t have to wait to stream her back catalog, which enjoyed a sizable streaming boost in the midst of the excitement.
Trending on Billboard
From Aug. 12-14, Swiftâ€™s catalog earned nearly 110 million official U.S. on-demand streams, according to Luminate; that total marked a 57% bump from the three-day period right before the New Heights podcast tease (70 million streams from Aug. 8-10). Meanwhile, one Swift song has been resurgent for a non-Showgirl reason: â€œFalse God,â€ from 2019â€™s Lover, was featured in the Aug. 13 episode of the hit Amazon Prime series The Summer I Turned Pretty. The song earned 1.2 million streams from Aug. 13-15, up a whopping 383% from the previous weekend (250,000 streams). â€“ JASON LIPSHUTZ
Cardi Bâ€™s New â€˜Imaginary Playerzâ€™ Single Spurs Notable Gains for Jay-Z Gem It References
Cardi B is keeping her Am I the Drama? album campaign rolling, and for her latest single she looked to fellow New York hip-hop icon, Jay-Z. For â€œImaginary Playerz,â€ Cardi sampled Jayâ€™s â€œImaginary Players,â€ a Prestige-produced fan-favorite from 1997â€™s In My Lifetime, Vol. 1. Though Cardiâ€™s track, which dropped on Aug. 15, envisions Jayâ€™s original from a female perspective, her new single still spurred streaming gains for Hovâ€™s classic.
According to Luminate, Cardiâ€™s track pulled over 3.8 million official on-demand U.S. streams in its first four days of release (Aug. 15-18). During that same period, Jayâ€™s â€œImaginary Playersâ€ earned over 427,000 official streams, marking a whopping 313% increase from the 103,000 official streams it collected the weekend prior (Aug. 8-11).
Jayâ€™s original was never an official single, but the â€œImaginary Playersâ€ legacy lives on through Cardiâ€™s latest tease of her long-awaited sophomore studio album. â€” KYLE DENIS
â€˜Freaky Fridayâ€™ Sequel Bumps Songs From Original & New Movies
It was a sequel fans had waited over 20 years for: Freakier Friday debuted in theaters on Aug. 8, as the follow-up to 2003â€™s Freaky Friday, starring Jamie Lee Curits and Lindsay Lohan (itself a remake of the 1978 original with Jodie Foster and Barbara Harris). The movie is off to a respectable box office start, and has also resulted in major streaming gains for the songs featured in the movie â€” in which Pink Slip, Anna (Lohan)â€™s band from the original movie reunites â€” as well as for Pink Slip classics from the â€˜03 original.
The Freakier Friday soundtrack drew 879,000 official U.S. on-demand streams in total for the week ending Aug. 14 following the filmâ€™s release, according to Luminate â€” a gain of 153% over the prior week. Thatâ€™s led by nearly 586,000 streams for Pink Slipâ€™s re-recorded â€œTake Me Away,â€ nearly triple its tally the previous week. And there was enough enthusiasm left for peak Pink Slip from the new movie that the groupâ€™s â€œUltimateâ€ from Freaky also saw a spike, rising 74% to 229,000 streams for the week. (You can find the full story of all these songs in our Pink Slip reunion oral history here.) â€“ ANDREW UNTERBERGER
Viral â€˜Milkaholicâ€™ TikTok Trend Revives 20-Year-Old Metal Song
Between Sleep Token and Ghost topping the Billboard 200 earlier this year and a Pierce the Veil deep cut going viral, hard rock and metal are having notable moments in 2025. U.K. hardcore band Her Words Kill is the latest act to benefit from this wave, thanks to its fast-rising hit, â€œSir, This Is a Cutthroat Fashion.â€ Originally released on 2005â€™s Load My Revolver, Baby LP, â€œCutthroat Fashionâ€ has found new life as the primary song for a new â€œmilkaholicâ€ TikTok trend, inspired by Tom & Jerry.
In essence, TikTok users take shots of milk, intending to evoke the feeling of hitting rock bottom and nursing oneâ€™s alcoholism after a particularly rough day. User @noahnestell kicked off the trend with a Jul. 31 post set to â€œCutthroat Fashionâ€ and focusing on the lyrics, â€œBetter pack your tears into a suitcase/ And run away with my heart.â€ As the trend evolved, users swapped out milk for other non-alcoholic beverages such as Yakult and matcha. The sound attached to user @noahnestellâ€™s original video has garnered over 253,600 posts, while the official â€œCutthroat Fashionâ€ sound boasts just under 250 posts.
According to Luminate, â€œCutthroat Fashionâ€ earned just over 7,000 official on-demand U.S. streams during the week of July 18-24. That figure leapt 869% to nearly 70,000 official streams the following week (July 25-31), which included the day user @noahnestell shared his video. By the week of Aug. 1-7, â€œCutthroat Fashionâ€ grew a further 586% to over 476,000 official streams, and one week later (Aug. 8-14), the streaming activity jumped another 65% to over 790,000 official on-demand U.S. streams. â€” KD
articles.author: Kyle Denis; Jason Lipshutz; Andrew Unterberger

articles.title: What Chart Records Could Taylor Swift Break with â€˜The Life of a Showgirlâ€™?
articles.content:
---
title: What Chart Records Could Taylor Swift Break with â€˜The Life of a Showgirlâ€™?
author: Xander Zellner
url: https://www.billboard.com/lists/taylor-swift-the-life-of-a-showgirl-chart-records/
hostname: billboard.com
description: The superstar has plenty of chart accolades already under her belt â€” here are a few more she could tackle next.
sitename: Billboard
date: 2025-08-20
categories: ['Chart Beat']
tags: ['bbnews, Billboard, music, Music News, News']
---
Taylor Swift is officially back in album mode. On last weekâ€™s episode of Travis and Jason Kelceâ€™s New Heights podcast, the superstar revealed her 12th studio album, The Life of a Showgirl, due out Oct. 3. Along with the announcement, she also dropped a few key details: the cover art, a concise 12-song tracklist (a sharp contrast to the 31-track â€œdata dumpâ€ â€” as Swift referred to it on the podcast â€” of The Tortured Poets Department), a guest feature from Sabrina Carpenter and the return of longtime producers/collaborators Max Martin and Shellback, who helped craft some of Swiftâ€™s biggest hits from Red, 1989 and reputation.
The rollout marks another fascinating chapter in Swiftâ€™s career, and has left fans curious about what to expect. In the podcast, though, she said â€œ[The album is] a lot more upbeat, and itâ€™s a lot more fun pop excitement. My main goals were melodies that were so infectious, youâ€™re almost angry at it.â€ She added that all 12 songs are â€œbangersâ€ â€” not unlike the past hits she made with the Swedish pop masterminds, such as â€œShake It Offâ€ and â€œBlank Space.â€
â€œWeâ€™ve never actually made an album before where it was just the three of us, thereâ€™s no other collaborators,â€ she said. â€œIt felt like catching lightning in a bottle. These guys, theyâ€™re just geniuses. Working with them again was absolutely incredible.â€
One thing we know for certain is that Swift is in for a big chart week. Sheâ€™s already rewritten the Billboard record books countless times, and each new release seems to add more milestones to her rÃ©sumÃ©.
With six weeks until Showgirl arrives, hereâ€™s a look at some of the biggest chart records Swift could break â€” in some cases against fellow superstars, and in others, against herself.
-
Most No. 1 Albums on the Billboard 200 Among Solo Artists
Swift is currently tied with Drake and Jay-Z for the most No. 1 albums among solo artists with 14 No. 1s apiece, dating to the chartâ€™s launch in March 1956. If Showgirl debuts on top, sheâ€™ll be the first solo artist to tally 15 No. 1s â€” unless, perhaps, Drake drops his anticipated new album Iceman before Oct. 3. The Beatles lead all acts with 19 No. 1 albums.
-
Most Consecutive Calendar Years at No. 1 on the Billboard 200
If Showgirl opens at No. 1, Swift will extend her run of yearly chart-toppers to seven (2019-2025), tying The Beatles for the most consecutive calendar years with a new No. 1 album. The Fab Four reached the top every year from 1964-70. Swift has earned nine of her 14 total No. 1 albums in that span.
-
Largest Streaming Week for an Album
The Tortured Poets Department holds the record as the album with the largest streaming week ever, with 891.37 million on-demand official U.S. streams generated in its opening week (April 19-25, 2024). Since Showgirl is expected to have far fewer tracks (12 compared to 31), it will be much tougher to beat that record. But if anyone can outdo herself, itâ€™s Swift.
-
Most Vinyl Albums Sold in a Single Week in the Modern Era
The Tortured Poets Department also set the record here, selling 859,000 vinyl copies on the chart dated May 4, 2024 â€” the most for an album in a single week since Luminate began tracking music sales in 1991. We know that The Life of a Showgirl is already available for preorder, and Swift announced Monday (Aug. 18) that two special vinyl variants were available in her webstore, named The Life of a Showgirl: The Shiny Bug Edition. Both versions, available for preorder for only 48 hours (or â€œwhile supplies lastâ€), reportedly sold out in less than an hour. So we can be sure to expect another blockbuster vinyl week. The question is: can she clear that 859,000 bar?
-
Most Albums to Sell 1,000,000 Copies in a Single Week in the Modern Era
Since 1991, only 24 albums have sold 1 million-plus in the U.S. in a single week (in pure sales). Of those 24, Swift has the most, with seven (*NSYNC, Backstreet Boys and Eminem are tied for the second-most, with two apiece). If Showgirl joins the club, sheâ€™ll extend her record to eight. Swift cleared the 1-million mark with, in order: Speak Now (1.046 million; Nov. 13, 2010), Red (1.208 million; Nov. 10, 2012), 1989 (1.286 million; Nov. 15, 2014), reputation (1.216 million; Dec. 2, 2017), Midnights (1.14 million; Nov. 5, 2022), 1989 (Taylorâ€™s Version) (1.359 million; Nov. 11, 2023) and The Tortured Poets Department (1.913 million; May 4, 2024).
-
Only Artist to Sweep the Top 10 of the Hot 100 Three Times
Swift famously blanketed the entire top 10 of the Billboard Hot 100 on Nov. 5, 2022, after releasing Midnights, and then outdid herself by claiming the entire top 14 with Tortured Poets. With Showgirlâ€™s expected 12 tracks, she canâ€™t claim that record, but she could become the first artist to claim the entire top 10 three times, a feat no one else has achieved even once.
-
Most No. 1 Songs on the Hot 100 of the 2020s
Swift and Drake have both scored seven No. 1 songs on the Hot 100 in the 2020s so far â€” tied for the most among all artists this decade. If a track from Showgirl tops the chart, sheâ€™ll surpass him for the most (unless, of course, Drake scores a new No. 1 before then).
-
Most Top 5s, Top 10s, Top 20s, Top 40s and Overall Entries on the Hot 100 Among Women
Among women, Swift already holds the records for the most top 5s (36), top 10s (59), top 20s (100), top 40s (165) and overall entries (264). Among all artists, only Drake ranks higher on these lists. But the 12 tracks from Showgirl could help her narrow the gap, or at least extend her lead among women.
articles.author: Xander Zellner

articles.title: Hereâ€™s Every Easter Egg Hinting That Taylor Swift Could Headline the 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Show
articles.content:
---
title: Hereâ€™s Every Easter Egg Hinting That Taylor Swift Could Headline the 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Show
author: Hannah Dailey
url: https://www.billboard.com/lists/taylor-swift-super-bowl-2026-halftime-clues-easter-eggs/
hostname: billboard.com
description: Is Taylor Swift headlining the Super Bowl 2026 Halftime Show? Here are all the possible Easter Egg clues hinting that she might.
sitename: Billboard
date: 2025-08-19
categories: ['Pop']
tags: ['genre pop, sports, Super Bowl Halftime Show']
---
Taylor Swift has traveled all over the world on tour, setting numerous stadium attendance records throughout her career. But thereâ€™s still one highly coveted gig she hasnâ€™t yet played: the Super Bowl.
Though rumors about her headlining the coveted halftime show spring up just about every year before the actual performer is announced, the pop star hasnâ€™t yet joined folks such as Kendrick Lamar, Usher, Rihanna and The Weeknd in crossing it off her list. Thatâ€™s remained true even as sheâ€™s become more entrenched in the football world than ever before over the past two years, cheering on her Kansas City Chiefs tight end boyfriend Travis Kelce at many of his games â€” including two back-to-back Super Bowls â€” after the pair first started dating in 2023.
Lately, though, fans have been wondering if thatâ€™s due to change â€” and soon. Especially as Swift gears up to release the Oct. 3-slated album The Life of a Showgirl â€” which sheâ€™s promised will be tailored for widespread commercial appeal, with a track list full of â€œbangersâ€ produced by bona fide hitmakers Max Martin and Shellback â€” some of the 14-time Grammy winnerâ€™s listeners are beginning to suspect that the musician is hinting that the 2026 Super Bowl at Leviâ€™s Stadium in Santa Clara, California, will feature a spectacular showcase from popâ€™s biggest showgirl herself.
The announcement for next yearâ€™s headliner could be just a few weeks away, as the past few yearsâ€™ performers have all been unveiled in September. That means the timing of Swift coming out with a new album so soon after 2024â€™s The Tortured Poets Department would perfectly align with a Super Bowl reveal. (But honestly, baby, whoâ€™s counting?)
With all that in mind, Billboard is keeping track of all the ways Swift might be hinting that sheâ€™ll play more of a role in next yearâ€™s big game than simply supporting her favorite player in the stands. Keep reading to see all the possible clues that the musician is headlining Super Bowl LX below.
-
The Super Bowl Talk on â€˜New Heightsâ€™
On Aug. 13, Swift announced the Oct. 3 release date of The Life of a Showgirl at the same time as her debut episode on Travis and Jason Kelceâ€™s New Heights podcast dropped. The topic of the Super Bowl came up casually (or perhaps, not so casually) a couple of times, including when the pop star revealed that she learned sheâ€™d purchased the rights to her master recordings just a few months after she attended the 2025 Super Bowl.
She discussed the event â€” and more specifically, its halftime program â€” again later on in the episode while detailing how little she used to pay attention to football growing up. â€œMy relationship with sports was like, I grew up in Pennsylvania, I always heard my dad yelling at the screen watching Eagles games,â€ she said. â€œI was up in my room playing guitar, learning instruments, playing piano â€” I was focused on different things. I would go to sporting events so that I could sing the national anthem. I know every halftime show from the Super Bowls, but I didnâ€™t watch the sports.â€
Were all of those mentions of the Super Bowl just happenstance, or was Swift hinting at something more? With her, one can never be sure.
-
The Sourdough
Also on New Heights, Swift just so happened to shout out one of her new favorite hobbies: â€œRight now weâ€™re deep in a sourdough obsession that has taken over my life â€¦ Iâ€™m really talking about bread 60% of the time now.â€
Why is that significant? Two reasons. Not only is Sourdough Sam the name of the mascot for the San Francisco 49ers â€” aka the team whose Leviâ€™s Stadium home is the site of next yearâ€™s Super Bowl â€” but the next NFL season-ending game will be the 60th Super Bowl, matching the percentage Swift used to describe her high level of bread talk as of late.
-
The Suspicious â€œ47â€
Much like the topic of the Super Bowl itself, Swift repeatedly brought up a certain number while on New Heights: 47. Following a particularly energetic intro from Jason Kelce listing her accomplishments at the beginning of the episode, the singer said, â€œThank you for screaming for like 47 seconds for me, that was so nice!â€
Later, when Jason asked how many countries sheâ€™d visited over the course of her Eras Tour, Swift quipped, â€œ47,000,â€ even though the real answer is 21.
Stay with us. In the sequence of 149 total shows Swift played while on her global Eras trek, the 47th one took place in July 2023 at Leviâ€™s Stadium â€” the same place where SBLX is set to go down next February. The musician also chose a sparkly orange outfit to wear while performing â€œShake It Offâ€ at one of her shows in Santa Clara (as pictured above), which was possibly one of the earliest Easter Eggs she deployed to tease the distinctly orange color scheme of her then-unannounced Life of a Showgirl album.
You may be wondering if placing such significance on the numbers 47 and 60 is too much of a stretch â€” but itâ€™s worth remembering that Swift is a known fan of hiding clues about her next moves in numbers. Even on New Heights, she said, â€œThe art of the Easter Egg â€¦ thereâ€™s doâ€™s and donâ€™ts. I love numerology, I love math stuff, I love dates. That stuff I find really fun.â€
-
The Leviâ€™s of a â€˜Showgirlâ€™
Every brand from Target to Crumbl, FedEx, McDonaldâ€™s and more shared Swift-themed posts in light of her stepping into the Showgirl era, but one in particular stands out. Denim company Leviâ€™s â€” the company behind Leviâ€™s Stadium â€” shared a video of someone sewing a sparkly orange tag into the pocket of a pair of jeans in honor of the pop star announcing her new album.
â€œsubtle swap for the big day,â€ the caption read.
Now, the post may have just been Leviâ€™s getting in on the trend. But maybe, just maybe, it was actually the businessâ€™ way of hinting that Swift will play at its stadium next February.
-
The Masters of It All
Itâ€™s worth noting that this coming Super Bowl will be the first to ever take place in a world where Swift owns her masters. After spending her career working to gain ownership of her first six albums, the singer was finally able to buy them from Shamrock Holdings in May.
On New Heights, Swift spoke about how meaningful itâ€™s been for her to have control of her lifeâ€™s work. It also goes without saying that the singer is likely more keen to perform her early hits on the most-watched televised event of the year now that she, and no other entities â€” such as Scooter Braun, whose initial purchase of her catalog in 2019 she vehemently opposed â€” will be the only one to benefit financially from the show.
articles.author: Hannah Dailey

articles.title: Diddy Beats Case, Young Thug Gets His Stuff, Feds Target Taylor Swift Tickets & More Music Law
articles.content:
---
title: Diddy Beats Case, Young Thug Gets His Stuff, Feds Target Taylor Swift Tickets & More Music Law
author: Bill Donahue
url: https://www.billboard.com/pro/diddy-ruling-young-thug-win-taylor-swift-tickets-music-law/
hostname: billboard.com
description: Diddy beats a civil lawsuit, Young Thug takes his stuff back, FTC sues over Taylor Swift tickets and more in this recap of music law news stories.
sitename: Billboard
date: 2025-08-19
categories: ['Legal News']
tags: ['law, lawsuit, Legal, The Legal Beat']
---
Diddy Beats Case, Young Thug Gets His Stuff, Feds Target Taylor Swift Tickets & More Music Law
In this week's Legal Beat newsletter, Diddy wins another lawsuit, Young Thug takes his property back, federal regulators sue bot scalpers and much more.
THE BIG STORY: Six weeks after Sean â€œDiddyâ€ Combs was largely acquitted on federal criminal charges, he won another court victory dismissing most of a $60 million civil sexual assault lawsuit filed by â€œMaking the Band 2â€ contestant Sara Rivers.
Rivers, who became a member of hip-hop group Da Band, sued Combs earlier this year â€“ accusing him of sexually harassing and groping her during the filming of the 2000s MTV reality show. But a federal judge last week dismissed 21 of the 22 counts in her lawsuit, including racketeering, assault and battery, forced labor, and false imprisonment.
Even after his recent courtroom wins, Diddy is hardly out of the woods. Heâ€™s still facing dozens of other civil lawsuits from other alleged victims, accusing him of rape, sexual assault, sexual harassment and various other forms of sexual abuse. And heâ€™s still going to be sentenced in October on the lesser criminal charges on which he was convicted â€“ counts that could still send him to prison for years. Stay tuned.
Trending on Billboard
Youâ€™re reading The Legal Beat, a weekly newsletter about music law from Billboard Pro, offering you a one-stop cheat sheet of big new cases, important rulings and all the fun stuff in between. To get the newsletter in your inbox every Tuesday, go subscribe here.
Other top stories this weekâ€¦
CARDI COPYRIGHT CLASH â€“ A pair of music producers suing Cardi B for copyright infringement over â€œEnough (Miami)â€ demanded an injunction that would prohibit the superstar from streaming or otherwise monetizing the track as the litigation moves forward. That includes barring her from putting the song on Am I the Drama?, her long-awaited sophomore album due Sept. 19 via Atlantic Records.
BOT CRACKDOWN â€“ The Federal Trade Commission launched a crackdown on alleged scalpers, filing a lawsuit accusing ticket broker Key Investment Group of using â€œillegal meansâ€ to purchase more than 379,000 event tickets on Ticketmaster and then re-selling them at massively-inflated prices. More than 2,000 of those tickets were allegedly for Taylor Swiftâ€™s Eras Tour â€“ the poster child for the problem of bot-scalpers and eye-watering secondary prices.
FORFEITURE FIGHT â€“ Young Thug won a court ruling ordering the return of property seized by law enforcement during his Atlanta gang trial, including nearly $150,000 in cash, several cars and numerous pieces of jewelry. The decision â€“ the judge said prosecutors missed key deadlines to litigate the case â€“ came a little under a year after Thugâ€™s stunning release from jail after pleading guilty in the RICO case.
CARTEL SENTENCING â€“ Music executive Ãngel Del Villar was sentenced to 48 months (4 years) in prison following his conviction on felony charges of doing business with a concert promoter linked to Mexican drug cartels. Prosecutors alleged that Del Villar repeatedly arranged concerts with Jesus PÃ©rez Alvear, a promoter with ties to Mexican cartels â€“ even though he knew he had been sanctioned by federal authorities.
TORYâ€™S APPEAL â€“ Attorneys for Tory Lanez (Daystar Peterson) went before a California appeals court for a crucial hearing in his efforts to overturn his convictions for shooting Megan Thee Stallion. They told the panel that Lanezâ€™s trial was â€œriddled with errors,â€ including misleading statements about DNA evidence and a key witness they were not allowed to properly cross examine. But the government was unconcerned, calling some of Lanezâ€™s arguments non-sensical: â€œThe evidence in this case was compelling.â€
DISCOVERY DRAMA â€“ Universal Music Group CEO Lucian Grainge fired back at Drakeâ€™s demand to read his emails amid the ongoing defamation lawsuit over the Kendrick Lamar diss track â€œNot Like Us,â€ calling the request â€œfarcicalâ€ and â€œridiculous.â€ He told a judge that it â€œmakes no sense whatsoeverâ€ that the boss of the worldâ€™s largest music company would play a role in the release of a single song and that Drake was trying to â€œwaste my and UMGâ€™s time.â€
UNSURPRISING DIVORCE â€“ Kate Bowman, the wife of founding Maroon 5 bassist Mickey Madden, filed for divorce, just two weeks after she sought a restraining order in which she accused the musician of beating her during a confrontation about disturbing and sexual texts heâ€™d sent to teenage girls. Seeking spousal support and a separation of assets, Bowman cited â€œirreconcilable differencesâ€ with Madden as the cause for the split.
DYLANâ€™S REVENGE â€“ Bob Dylan won legal penalties at a federal appeals court against two lawyers who filed â€” and then quickly dropped â€” a lawsuit accusing the icon of sexually abusing a child in the 1960s. seeking the sanctions against the duo (Daniel W. Isaacs and Peter J. Gleason), Dylanâ€™s lawyers said they made â€œheinous and false allegationsâ€ without sufficient vetting and then repeatedly violated a court order by failing to get their client to turn over key evidence.
UGLY ACCUSATIONS â€“ Priscilla Presleyâ€™s former business partners (Brigitte Kruse and Kevin Fialko) fired back at her recent allegations of elder abuse against them, filing a countersuit that included the shocking accusation that Elvis Presleyâ€™s widow â€œpulled the plugâ€ on Lisa Marie Presley against her late daughterâ€™s wishes. Priscillaâ€™s attorney â€” veteran entertainment lawyer Martin Singer â€” quickly called the case a â€œdisgusting publicity stuntâ€ and â€œone of the most shameful, ridiculous, salacious, and meritless lawsuits I have seen in my practice.â€
DEFAULT JUDGMENT â€“ Jimmie Allen was judged liable for sexually assaulting and secretly filming a woman in a Las Vegas hotel room in 2022. Allen has denied those accusations, but a judge ruled that he had forfeited his right to defend himself by flouting multiple court-imposed deadlines and orders in the lawsuit. The case is one of two civil sexual assault lawsuits brought against Allen in 2023, derailing the singerâ€™s promising career; the first was settled in 2024.
GEFFEN RESPONDS â€“ Music and film mogul David Geffen filed his first response to a bombshell abuse lawsuit from his estranged husband Donovan Michaels, calling them â€œa ludicrous and contrived attempt to humiliate Geffen in the court of public opinion and extract an out-of-court settlement.â€ The case from Michaels, a former exotic dancer 50 years Geffenâ€™s junior, claimed that the Hollywood powerhouse treated him as a â€œsexual commodityâ€ for years.
KINGSTON SENTENCING â€“ Sean Kingston was sentenced to 42 months (3.5 years) in prison and three years probation after being convicted of federal wire fraud over a scheme involving over $1 million in high-end cars, jewelry and other luxury goods. Kingston, who topped the charts with his 2007 â€œBeautiful Girls,â€ was convicted in March alongside his mother for essentially conning vendors into giving him merch â€“ including a Cadillac Escalade and a massive LED television â€” by falsely promising payment.
FESTIVAL FRAUD â€“ A new lawsuit claimed that a booking agent named Christopher Young lied about securing Doechii and SiR as headliners for a Baltimore music festival this summer, then snagged a nearly $200,000 deposit from the showâ€™s organizer and pocketed the cash even after his scheme unraveled. The suit claims that Young â€œnever spoke to anyoneâ€ about Doechii and had only â€œpreliminary conversationsâ€ about locking down SiR for the festival.

While there, the singer and tight end maintained a steady stream of PDA and rocked out to The Darknessâ€™ â€œI Believe in a Thing Called Love.â€
-
Sept. 11, 2024: Taylor Thanks Travis at the VMAs
Fans at the 2024 MTV Video Music Awards erupted into ear-splitting cheers when Swift gave Kelce a sweet shout-out during her video of the year acceptance speech, having secured the prestigious Moon Person for her â€œFortnightâ€ collaboration with Post Malone.
â€œThis video seems very sad when you watch it, but it was actually the most fun video to make,â€ she told the crowd before recalling how the tight end was present on the shoot. â€œI would always just hear someone cheering, like, â€˜Whoo!â€™ from across the studio â€” that one person was my boyfriend, Travis. Everything this man touches turns to happiness and fun and magic, so I want to thank him for adding that to our shoot.â€
-
Oct. 7, 2024: PDA After Chiefs Victory
Moments after Kansas City won 26-13 against the New Orleans Saints, Kelce joined his superstar girlfriend in her viewing area at Arrowhead Stadium for a sweet PDA-filled moment captured by fans. In one video, Swift hangs onto the tight endâ€™s arm as he chats with a person who appears to be his father, Ed Kelce, before pulling Travisâ€™ face toward hers for a kiss.
The New Heights host then wraps the 14-time Grammy winner in a tight hug, the pair swaying back and forth.
-
Nov. 2, 2024: Dancing to â€œSo High Schoolâ€
During Swiftâ€™s Indianapolis stop on her Eras Tour on Nov. 2, eagle-eyed fans spotted the Kansas City Chiefs tight end in the VIP section of the Lucas Oil Stadium, alongside Swiftâ€™s mom. In a fan-captured TikTok, Kelce was seen dancing along with his girlfriendâ€™s mom to the Tortured Poets Department track â€œSo High School,â€ with the fan filming offering an audible â€œoh my godâ€ at his moves.
-
Dec. 11, 2024: Travis Praises Eras Tour
â€œThe unbelievable Eras Tour has come to an end,â€ Travis said on his New Heights podcast. â€œShout out to everybody that was a part of that show. Obviously, itâ€™s her music, her tour and everything, but that was a full production, man. That thing was the best tour in the world because of a lot of people, but mostly because of Taylor.â€When Jason asked how many shows Swift had in the books following the summation of her $2 billion tour â€” which kicked off in March 2023 â€” Travis replied, â€œ149 or 152. I forget which one it was. Somewhere in there. A fâ€“k ton is how I sum it up.â€
-
Dec. 13, 2024: Taylorâ€™s 35th Birthday Party
Swift turned 35 on Dec. 13, and her friends and family surprised her with a fitting Eras Tour-themed birthday bash.
During one sweet moment in the night, Kelce recreated a special moment during the show in which the singer gives her hat to a lucky fan while performing â€œ22.â€ In a photo from the event, Travis is seen in his outfit from his surprise â€œI Can Do It With a Broken Heartâ€ moment putting the black top hat on his girlfriend.
See the photo here.
-
Feb. 9, 2025: Super Bowl Round 2
Swift attended her second Super Bowl in a row on Feb. 9, 2025, showing up to support Kelce alongside Ice Spice, MGK and more stars.
Unfortunately, the game ended with a less desirable outcome than Swiftâ€™s first Super Bowl, with the Chiefs losing 22-40 to the Philadelphia Eagles. The tight end was visibly upset on the field in the moments after the loss, but afterward, he was able to joke that his superstar girlfriendâ€™s music had been helping him through that particular heartbreak.
-
June 4, 2025: Travis Celebrates Taylor Reclaiming Her Masters
After years of publicly butting heads with Scott Borchetta and Scooter Braun over the sale of her master recordings in 2019 â€” plus four Taylorâ€™s Version album re-recordings â€” Swift finally purchased the rights to her first six LPs in May 2025.
The following month, Travis celebrated his partnerâ€™s feat on New Heights by cheering, â€œ[She] just bought all her music back â€¦ so itâ€™s finally hers.â€
Later, Taylor would appear on New Heights and reveal that she collapsed crying into Travisâ€™ arms when she first got the news that sheâ€™d successfully acquired her catalog.
-
June 24, 2025: Tight End University
Swift accompanied Kelce at his 2025 Tight End University summit in Nashville, appearing alongside him at opening ceremonies and later playing a surprise performance of â€œShake It Offâ€ with Kane Brown and his band at Brooklyn Bowl Nashville.
Later, Kelce would proudly boast about how his girlfriend didnâ€™t even practice before getting up onstage to sing for his guests. â€œTay just kind of went up to him and the band and went, â€˜Hey, if you guys are down, Iâ€™ll go up there, play a song and see if we can pop the roof off this place,â€™â€ he recalled on New Heights. â€œAnd then just went out there without practicing, and it was pitch-perfect. [She] just killed it.â€
-
July 1, 2025: Travis Denies Theyâ€™re â€œTrying to Seek Attentionâ€
While appearing on an episode of Bussinâ€™ With the Boys, Travis refuted claims that he and Swift purposefully try to attract attention when they step out in public. â€œIt gets thrown out there, like weâ€™re trying to seek attention every now and then,â€ he said on the podcast. â€œWeâ€™re just enjoying life and having fun, going to hockey games. [Iâ€™m] kind of introducing her to some more of the sports world.â€
-
July 24, 2025: Travis Recaps His Offseason â€œAdventuresâ€ With Taylor
After about two years of keeping his relationship with Swift largely off of his social media accounts, Kelce surprised fans by sharing numerous photos of himself and the singer on Instagram captioned, â€œHad some adventures this offseason.â€
In the pics, he and Swift pose together in matching ship captain hats, get cozy together at a restaurant and play in the snow. Other photos show the tight end with the hitmakerâ€™s brother, Austin, as they hang out with Jason Kelce outdoors â€” proving that the Kelce and Swift families are super tight.
-
Aug. 12, 2025: Travis Explains How He Fell in Love With Taylor â€œOrganicallyâ€
In a GQ cover story, Kelce opened up about how he and Swift fell in love completely â€œorganically,â€ despite having the worldâ€™s attention on them at all times.
â€œWhenever Iâ€™m with her, it feels like weâ€™re just regular people,â€ he told the publication. â€œWhen there is not a camera on us, weâ€™re just two people that are in love â€¦ We fell in love just based off the people we were sitting in a room together with. We are two fun-loving people who have the morals to appreciate everyone for who they are. We share all those values. It kind of just took the fâ€“k off.â€
In that same interview, Kelce also noted how Swift shares important traits with his mom, Donna â€” â€œTheir kindness, their genuineness, their ability to say hello to everyone in the roomâ€ â€” as well as gushed about how the couple loves being each otherâ€™s â€œplus one.â€
-
Aug. 13, 2025: Taylor Reaches â€˜New Heightsâ€™
After two years of dating, Swift finally appeared on Kelceâ€™s podcast â€” and she covered a lot of ground while she was there.
In addition to opening up about reclaiming her masters, rediscovering her hobbies post-Eras Tour and taking care of her dad, Scott, after he underwent heart surgery, the pop star revealed details about her 12th studio album, The Life of a Showgirl â€” which Kelce had helped her announce to the world via a New Heights teaser clip the day prior to the full episodeâ€™s premiere â€” on the show. She also shared her side of the story of how Kelce won her over with his failed Eras friendship bracelet plot two years prior, something she jokingly called a â€œman tantrum.
â€œHe didnâ€™t even reach out to our management,â€ Swift said on New Heights, laughing. â€œWhen this podcast came out, I was like, â€˜Did he ever reach out to be, like, in the tents, or did we know he was in the building?â€™ He came with [Patrick Mahomes], and he thought that because he knows the elevator lady that he could talk to her about just getting down to my dressing room.
â€œIt felt more like I was in an â€™80s John Hughes movie, and he was standing outside of my window with a boombox saying, â€˜I want to date you! Do you want to go on a date with me? I made you a friendship bracelet! Do you want to date me?â€™â€ she added. â€œI was like, â€˜If this guyâ€™s not crazy, this is sort of what Iâ€™ve been writing songs about wanting to happen to me since I was a teenager.â€™â€
articles.author: Rania Aniftos; Hannah Dailey

articles.title: Taylor Swift Unveils â€˜Life of a Showgirl: Shiny Bug Editionâ€™ Vinyl â€” Available for Only 48 Hours
articles.content:
---
title: Taylor Swift Unveils â€˜Life of a Showgirl: Shiny Bug Editionâ€™ Vinyl â€” Available for Only 48 Hours
author: Hannah Dailey
url: https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/taylor-swift-shiny-bug-showgirl-vinyl-1236046451/
hostname: billboard.com
description: Taylor Swift has dropped limited 'The Life of a Showgirl: The Shiny Bug Edition' vinyls that are only available for purchase for 48 hours.
sitename: Billboard
date: 2025-08-18
categories: ['Music News']
tags: ['genre pop, Music News']
---
Taylor Swift is keeping the surprises coming ahead of her new album The Life of a Showgirl, with the 14-time Grammy winner unveiling two new vinyl variants on her website Monday (Aug. 18).
Available for pre-order at 2 p.m. ET â€” hours after a mysterious countdown appeared on Swiftâ€™s site teasing the drop â€” the brand new The Life of a Showgirl: The Shiny Bug Edition collection features an exclusive set of goodies that can only be purchased over the next two days. The limited editions are only available while supplies last until 1:59 p.m. ET on Wednesday (Aug. 20).
Available in two colors â€” wintergreen onyx and violet shimmer â€” the marbled Shiny Bug vinyl records feature exclusive cover art depicting Swift wearing a dark, sparkly leotard with flared spikes and matching gloves. They also come with a full-size gatefold photograph of Swift, a double-sided foldout panel displaying a special poem she wrote for the set and a collection of exclusive photographs.
Trending on Billboard
The news comes less than a week after the pop star announced The Life of a Showgirl â€” her 12th studio album â€” on Aug. 12, via a teaser clip for her interview on Jason and Travis Kelceâ€™s New Heights podcast. The full episode featuring Swift arrived the following day, with the musician sharing more details about the LP â€” including its cover art, production team and tracklist â€” on the show and in an Instagram post.
â€œ[The album is] a lot more upbeat, and itâ€™s a lot more fun pop excitement,â€ she said on the show. â€œMy main goals were melodies that were so infectious, youâ€™re almost angry at it.â€
With Max Martin and Shellback serving as Swiftâ€™s only co-producers on Showgirl, the 12-track project features a collaboration with Sabrina Carpenter on the title track. At the time Swift first announced the LP last week, she also debuted four alternate versions of the album â€” the â€œSweat and Vanilla Perfumeâ€ edition, the â€œItâ€™s Frighteningâ€ edition, the â€œItâ€™s Rapturousâ€ edition and the â€œItâ€™s Beautifulâ€ edition â€” that each come with different artwork and photo cards, as well as a jewelry box with a different collectible charm bracelet.
As opposed to Swiftâ€™s last album, the sprawling 35-track Tortured Poets Department â€” which spent 17 weeks at No. 1 on the Billboard 200 â€” the singer has also promised that Showgirl will not have any bonus tracks beyond the core 12 on the tracklist.
â€œThereâ€™s no other songs coming,â€ she emphasized on New Heights. â€œThis is the record Iâ€™ve been wanting to make for a very long time.â€
articles.author: Hannah Dailey

articles.title: FTC Sues Ticket Reseller Over Taylor Swift Eras Tour Scalping: â€˜Unscrupulous Middlemenâ€™
articles.content:
---
title: FTC Sues Ticket Reseller Over Taylor Swift Eras Tour Scalping: â€˜Unscrupulous Middlemenâ€™
author: Bill Donahue
url: https://www.billboard.com/pro/taylor-swift-eras-tour-tickets-illegally-resold-ftc-lawsuit/
hostname: billboard.com
description: Taylor Swift Eras Tour tickets were illegally resold by a company for more than $1 million in profit, says a new FTC lawsuit.
sitename: Billboard
date: 2025-08-18
categories: ['Legal News']
tags: ['genre pop, Legal, Live, Pop, scalping, Touring']
---
FTC Sues Ticket Reseller Over Taylor Swift Eras Tour Scalping: â€˜Unscrupulous Middlemenâ€™
The feds are cracking down on a group that allegedly used "illegal means" to buy and resell hundreds of thousands of concert tickets at high prices.
Federal regulators say a company illegally bought thousands of tickets to Taylor Swiftâ€™s Eras Tour and resold them at inflated prices for more than $1 million in profit, according to a new lawsuit.
In a complaint filed Monday (Aug. 18) by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC), the watchdog group accused ticket broker Key Investment Group LLC of using â€œillegal meansâ€ to purchase more than 379,000 event tickets on Ticketmaster, including 2,280 for Swiftâ€™s record-shattering Eras concerts.
By â€œcharging a significant markup to consumersâ€ when reselling those tickets, attorneys for the FTC say Key Investment Group made roughly $7 million in profit â€” and deprived concertgoers of the chance to buy them at a fair price.
Trending on Billboard
In a statement announcing the case, FTC Chairman Andrew N. Ferguson said the agency was sending a message to â€œunscrupulous middlemen who harm fans and jack up prices through anticompetitive methods.â€
â€œTodayâ€™s action puts brokers on notice that the Trump-Vance FTC will police operations that unlawfully circumvent ticket sellersâ€™ purchase limits, ensuring that consumers have an opportunity to buy tickets at fair prices,â€ Ferguson said.
In a statement, Key Investment Group said it would â€œvigorously defend itselfâ€ against a â€œclear example of regulatory overreach.â€
â€œThe case threatens to dismantle the secondary ticket market for live events, further consolidating power in the hands of the industryâ€™s largest monopoly,â€ the group said.
Ticketmaster and parent company Live Nation were not named in the lawsuit nor accused of any wrongdoing.
Swiftâ€™s Eras Tour wrapped in December with a record-shattering haul of more than $2 billion in face-value ticket sales over a two-year run. The unprecedented demand for the tickets led to a disastrous presale in November 2022 and then created an infamously pricey resale market throughout the run.
In Mondayâ€™s lawsuit, the FTC says Key Investment bought at least 10 tickets to 38 different Eras Tour concerts, paying a total of $744,970.29. It then resold them on the secondary market for $1,961,980.65, netting $1,217,010.36 in profit.
At just one concert â€” Taylorâ€™s stop at Las Vegasâ€™ Allegiant Stadium in March 2023 â€” Key Investment allegedly used 49 different accounts to buy 273 tickets, a move the FTC says â€œdramatically exceededâ€ the six-ticket limit imposed by Ticketmaster.
To get around such limits, FTC says the group used â€œthousands of fictitious Ticketmaster accounts,â€ as well as proxy or spoofed IP addresses, virtual credit cards and fictitious names.
Notably, the lawsuit claims the group also used so-called SIM banks â€” a device holding hundreds of cellphone SIM cards commonly used by scammers to send text messages from different phone numbers. The group allegedly used the banks to receive the unique verification codes sent by Ticketmaster to thwart the use of ticket-buying bots.
Mondayâ€™s case was filed under the Better Online Ticket Sales Act, or BOTS Act, a 2016 statute that makes it illegal to use technology like bots to buy tickets en masse by skirting platform restrictions.
â€œBy circumventing Ticketmasterâ€™s security measures, access control systems, or other technological controls or measures to buy tickets, and then selling or offering to sell the tickets, Defendants have violated and continue to violate the [BOTS] Act,â€ the lawsuit says.
But in its response statement, Key Investment Group said the lawsuit â€œtwisted the intentâ€ of the BOTS Act and turned it into â€œa weapon against legitimate businesses and consumers.â€
â€œUnder the FTCâ€™s interpretation, anyone who purchases more than four tickets or uses more than one account could be deemed in violation of federal law,â€ the group said. â€œThat outcome is not only illogical, it is absurd.â€
Key Investment Group is an active member of the National Association of Ticket Brokers (NATB), the countryâ€™s largest trade lobby of ticket brokers and resellers.
The FTC complaint â€œhighlights an important unresolved issue: How to clearly define what constitutes an illegal bot,â€ NATBâ€™s head attorney, Gary Adler, tells Billboard in an email.
â€œSince 2016, the line between innovative, widely available tools that facilitate secure transactions and software designed to cheat fans has remained blurred,â€ he continues, noting that â€œupcoming proceedings are an important opportunity to draw these distinctions for regulators, the industry, and consumers.â€
This isnâ€™t the first time that Swiftâ€™s infamously pricey tickets led to a crackdown. Earlier this year, New York prosecutors brought criminal charges against a â€œcybercrime crewâ€ that allegedly stole more than 900 tickets to the Eras Tour and other events and then resold them for more $635,000 in illegal profit.
articles.author: Bill Donahue
